question: My 30 year old daughter has had Type I Diabetes since she was 7.  She has had so many health issues but until she got married and wanted to start a family, she was able to deal through most of it a day at a time.  With the onset of gastroparesis, she has now been told she has to choose between the gastro issue and having a baby.  As those of you with diabetic children can attest, you have already seen them have to deal with health issues and scenarios that would nobody should have to deal with.  The diabetes is a terrible enough disease that causes so very many problems.  But to have your dream of having children dashed is a pretty tough consequence to hear.  Does anybody have anything similar that might give us some hope or have places online or medical sources that we can look into.  When I talked to her just now after the doctor's appointment, she was just short of hysterical.  As a mom, I'm not even sure what to say to her.  I feel like there's knife in my heart too.  Thank you for reading my post.
title: Type 1 w/Gastroparesis trying to get pregnant
